Comment: Marcus Kann smiled in heaven... for now.
The attacking line. If Black plays 4... P-K3, he loses the best feature of the Caro-Kann -- the ability to freely develop his QB.
4... N-KB3 guards the P and leaves the development of the B open.
...White forces the recapture with the Q.
Better is the simple retreat 6... Q-Q1. Both sides would have 1 piece developed and Black's game would be quite tenable.
If Black now tries 8... Q-QB3??? to keep the QNP defended, Whitte has 9 B-QN5!!! winning the Q!

..but now Black resigns. White threatens 10 N-B7 ch with a shakrukh or 10 N-N6 PxN 11 RxR winning the Exchange. 9... N-R3 sems to guard everything but White has 10 RxN!! PxR 11 N-B7 ch ending up a piece ahead.
